data.title: Good when it was open!
data.text: Tis restaurant was sold to the city for it's building and no longer exists. So sad, it was in business for yrs!

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Love love their pizza so fresh and so delicious. Great location the restaurant is so cute. Great for a date.

data.title: A great taste of Modesto
data.text: Great old Modesto landmark restaurant. Outstanding American and Italian cuisine. Fresh seafood, steaks, chops and pasta. Daily specials!  Great old-time atmosphere with dark wood throughout and comfy booths. Cozy bar with fireplace. Great wait staff.

data.title: Old world service and charm
data.text: This has been an old friend for me for 30 + years. Good food and a charming atmosphere. I no longer work nearby and I need to get back more often.

data.title: Worth finding this hide-away
data.text: Don't let the dark exterior fool you, the place is worth the adventure. Grilled chicken and fries - you won't go wrong. They have a full bar, which is lively. Dining area is separate and it definitely works.

data.title: Hidden Treasure
data.text: I find that Gervasoni's Restaurant is not even mentioned in many of the internet sites for Modesto restaurants.  Why not?  If they mention Bella Italia, which serves canned and frozen vegetables and pasta, why wouldn't they mention a place that serves fresh, delicious meats and vegetables prepared well?  We just ate at Gervasoni's for the first time, and I was shocked that I had not known of its existence although I've lived here for many years. The service, atmoshpher, and, most importantly, the food was above average. My lamb chops were cooked perfectly, the side vegetables were fresh (not frozen as in many places here in town), and the portion was plentiful.  I left feeling that I'd gotten a good value for the price, and that I'd very much like to go back again.

data.title: Gervasoni's is not what it use to be
data.text: My family of 4 ate at Gervasoni's last night.  What a disappointment.  I hate to witness a restaurant that has declined from what use to be good place to eat.  In past times, it use to be  a vibrant and happening place, but sadly, not any more.  On past occasions when we have dined at this restaurant on a Friday night, the bar was full and so was the dining area.  Fast forward to today and this was not the case.  Maybe one or 2 people at the bar, and only 3 tables were occupied. The menu also has been vastly minimized to just one page.  I had the chicken marsala (at $19.99, it wasn't cheap!), which was swimming in oil when it arrived.  My husband and teenage children had the meatballs and spaghetti, and they could barely eat it, calling it 'sweet' and void of any sort of red spaghetti sauce, just greasy meat.  Don't waste your time at this restaurant.  I wouldn't be surprised if they close their doors in the next 6 months.

data.title: Don't Miss This One When You're in Modesto!
data.text: Want something different than the usual corporate chain restaurants you find by the Highway?  This is the place! It has a great retro feel, with dark wood and a friendly wait staff.  You'll probably notice that the clientele is loyal and the servers have been with the establishment a long time, a good sign that everyone is happy here.  The bar is  inviting and the drinks have an actual kick to them.

data.title: Good wholesome food.
data.text: Good food. Wholesome food. Make you think home cooked. Love the frog legs. A Modesto must try. A little pricey for Modesto, but is good.
